_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:54:42 using v2.1
title: What proportion of admissions to a psychiatric ward were 'gate kept' by a CRHT team?
analysis_commentary:
It is hoped that the intensive, short-term support of a CRHT team could prevent hospital admissions. However, in some cases, admission is still necessary. In cases where an admission is the result of a mental health crisis, CRHT teams should be involved in the decision to admit and will have assessed the service user prior to admission. The national threshold is that 95% of all admissions to a psychiatric inpatient ward is gate kept by a CRHT team.

Here we see that, in all quarters, the proportion of admissions which were gate kept by a CRHT team is above the national threshold of 95% and has remained around 98% since 2011-12 Q3. In 2013-14 Q4 this was 98.3%.
